And He who sat on him was called Faithful and True,

and in righteousness He judges and makes war.

His eyes were like a flame of fire,

and on His head were many crowns.

and His Name is called The Word of God.

white and clean, followed Him on white horses.

that with it He should strike the nations.

and wrath of Almighty God.

"This is now the second letter that I am writing to you, beloved. In both of them I am stirring up your sincere mind by way of reminder,

T

hat you should remember (learn and know)

the predictions (prophecies) of the holy prophets

and the commandment of the Lord and Savior through your apostles,

Knowing this first of all,

T

hat scoffers will come in the last days

with scoffing, following their own sinful desires.

They will say, Where is the promise of His coming?

For ever since the fathers fell asleep,

all things are continuing as they were from the beginning of Creation.

For they deliberately overlook this fact,

that the heavens existed long ago,

and the Earth was formed out of water and through water by the Word of God,

and that by means of these

the world that then existed was deluged with water and perished.

But by the same word

the heavens and Earth that now exist

are stored up for fire,

being kept until the Day of judgment and destruction of the ungodly.



But do not overlook this one fact, beloved,

that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness,

but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish,

but that all should reach repentance (turn back to God and His Word).

But the day of the Lord WILL come like a thief,

and then the heavens will pass away with a roar,

and the heavenly bodies will be burned up and dissolved,

and the Earth and the works that are done on it will be exposed."

(2 Peter 3:1-10)

Daily Bible Reading - Day 83:

Joshua 11-13... Luke 4:1-32

--Alpha News Daily

The First Amendment to the United States Constitution states: "Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble ..." The Constitution of the United States protects our citizens and churches with the "Right To Assemble." No "asterisks" were given to State Governors with which to revoke this Right.

Many don't realize that (through our Founding Fathers) God gave us a Republic form of Democracy which is ruled by a "king."

America's king IS the Constitution of the United States ... our Rule of Law.

According to our Constitution, the Congress, Executive Branch, and Supreme Court (and State Governors) are all subservient to the Constitution ... our Rule of Law ... the ruling "king" of this nation (under God).

As we are seeing a growing number of states revoking our Constitutional Right to Assemble it should be noted that every Mayor or City/County Council in those states has just as much right to re-establish our right to assemble as any State Governor has to revoke our right to assemble.

More people will suffer through this Coronavirus panic through the revocation of their right to work or run their businesses than will suffer through this virus.

Many of our family owned restaurants and businesses will not survive. These businesses employ many of the most economically vulnerable members of our society.



The responsibility of a Government to quarantine those who are sick and and contagious is well established (except for AIDS which was the first politically protected deadly disease ever in the history of this nation which has killed and destroyed countless more lives than this Coronavirus will).



If people are contagious and showing flu-like symptoms in a church or restaurant, they can and should be asked to leave to protect others around them. We are commanded to "Treat others as we would wish to be treated." Most of us would not like our families to have to sit next to somebody in a restaurant or a church who is coughing and sneezing in a flu-like manner. It is not unreasonable to have them go home until they feel better and are no longer contagious.

This is is common sense and common law.

However, to quarantine the healthy is overstepping our Constitutional limits of power.

This nation has survived far worse threats ... the Flu epidemic of 1918, the Swine Flu, SARS, MERS, West Nile Fever, AIDS, etc.

A number of years ago members of our Democrat Party chuckled over the phrase "Never let a good crisis go to waste", meaning that during the cover of a crisis they like to take away our freedoms through new "regulations" and "control" under the seductive and deceptive phrase "We are only doing this for the good of the people."

From a Bible Prophecy perspective there are several aspects to this Global (One-World) situation that could be relevant ...

- A prophetic "Deadly Diseases Will Spread" warning and sign reminder

- A prophetic "Beware of "Lying, Deceiving, and Being Deceived" warning and sign

- The United States will one day be "neutralized" (unable or unwilling to help defend Israel in the coming War against Russia-Iran-Turkey). Biblically and prophetically America will be absent during this coming Russia-Iran War against Israel. "Neutralized" through either Economic, Political or Military (any or all of the above) means. This crisis could lead to changes which we cannot now foresee.

- This sudden and unexpected global "lock-down" over populations could also very well help prepare the way for a coming powerful World Leader who we are warned will one-day rise in power who has been given many different titles in the Bible including the "Antichrist" who will be a very popular leader (and a man of "peace" and a great deceiver) who will rise over a "One-World" Global Economy, Religion, and Government (which prophetically appears to have all the markings of a Socialist-style government).

We will simply have to pray, watch, and see what eventually happens.

My advice to everyone is ...

"Dont worry (or be anxious) about anything, but pray about everything . . .with thanksgiving" (Philippians 4:6) (Did you know this is a commandment?) "For God has not given us a spirit of fear ..." (2 Timothy 1:7) "EXAMINE yourselves as to whether you are in the faith. TEST yourselves. Do you not know yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you - unless indeed you are disqualified." (2 Corinthians 13:5) "WATCH therefore, and pray ALWAYS that you may be counted worthy to ESCAPE all these things that WILL come to pass . . ." (Luke 21:36) Prophecies: The coming RAPTURE

" In 1988, during a sermon in La Paz, Bolivia, Pope John Paul II lashed out against American evangelicals, calling them sheep-stealing rapacious wolves and dangerous sects (the Vaticans term for cults). Such animosity was undoubtedly inspired by the explosive growth of evangelical Christianity in the predominately Catholic countries of Latin America. In one Latin American country, a Catholic bishop has even threatened holy war against Christian evangelicals. Speaking to the 31st National Conference of the Bishops of Brazil, the worlds most populace Catholic country, Bishop Sinesio Bohn vowed, We will declare holy war; dont doubt it. The Catholic Church has a ponderous structure, but when we move, well smash anyone beneath us. (http://www.timefortruth.org/articles/article/1769733/28262.htm)
